Articles.Content: We could pester Yougui for Venera probes (it's right up his alley), and Zenit satellites were very Vostok-like, so it should be possible to just make another spherical capsule fitting Vostok SM for this. Though I agree about Molniya, they and their LV would be really useful. Also, GLOSNASS sats for use with GPS mods out there would be nice, and the L1 spacecraft (it'd only need a dinky nose module and a payload shroud, all the other parts are here already).

aye, nice that someone agrees with me... I'll try begging mrthebull for the meteor weather sat if I can... Proton for original Ur-500 would be nice too (simply to have a sphere of 20 tons...imagine yourself adding a small engine and fuel tank and then playing bowling...IN SPACE...Im sure Jeb would beg for adding a rover seat on the sphere...)
What about the Briz-M proton upper stage? It'd be quite neat.
So... does anyone know how to make the Orion capsule survive landing at kerbin? It always hits the ground with ~50 m/s for me.

What about the Briz-M proton upper stage? It'd be quite neat.

Think bobcat said he'll do one... however only the one with the donut tank, not the smaller one without.
Compare the parachute cfg for Orion to the one sumghai just released for the SDHI SM. Apparently the modules are in the wrong order or something, or the cut speeds aren't right.

Compare the parachute cfg for Orion to the one sumghai just released for the SDHI SM. Apparently the modules are in the wrong order or something, or the cut speeds aren't right.

Lol, that was exactly what I did. I've already gotten it to work. The only thing that needs doing is to reverse the order of the MODULE{parachutes}.

Think bobcat said he'll do one... however only the one with the donut tank, not the smaller one without.

He already made the Block D, which is what you're referring to. Briz-M is the one without the doughnut tank.

I've done tests taking the Orion up to 10,000 km above kerbin, deorbiting so that I'm falling straight Down, managed to hit the atmosphere at 3.7 km/s deployed my chutes at the proper altitude and only came in .2 m/s (5.7 m/s after the main chutes deployed as opposed to 5.5 m/s for a normal decent)faster then in a normal LKO decent.

Edited October 13, 2013 by DarthVader
WOW that's amazing!

You know what would make the Pack even better, if you could get with someone who knows the code to make scenarios and get with them to make a save with stuff like a Soyuz ready to be docked to Mir, Buran docking to Mir, Etc.. It would add a new better layer to make this mod even better.
I have a bug to report - With Orion, the parachutes bring me down at 40m/s

Here's some more info on the Briz-M:

Russian Space Web:http://www.russianspaceweb.com/briz.html

Official Website:http://www.ilslaunch.com/launch-services/ils-proton-breeze-m-launch-vehicle

TheCanadianVendingMachine

Hmm.

Maybe this help

6.30 parachute system work.

Edited October 13, 2013 by BobCat
Ha ha, leet FTW!
How do you make the Buran arm work? It just doesn't like to work, it always rips apart the cargo and shuttle when I use it....
Engage precision controls and don't forget to strut the arm down. And be very careful with it. That's all the advice I can give.

don't forget to strut the arm down

ah, I never did that before, maybe it will work now

Hey, Bobcat, there is a way to make the Orion parachutes work without having to cut parachutes. All you need to do is to switch the two MODULE{parachutes} modules out, cut-pasting the second parachute up before the first parachute module.
I'm having some weird issues with the parts for The ares v disappearing when I transition from VAB to flight scene, must be a KSP bug.
Damn, that's smexy!

Really looking forward to playing with the piggyback launcher =)

Will the Buran maintain its current payload capabilitys when launched like that?

This not for Buran.

Buran never can start in 10km alt.
